name: Lowland Oaf
text: {T}: Target Goblin creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains flying until end of turn. Sacrifice that creature at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor: "I don't know why the little one was so mad. He said to put him down, and I put him down."

name: Lowland Tracker
text:
First strike
Provoke (Whenever this creature attacks, you may have target creature defending player controls untap and block it if able.)

editions.flavor:
"I feed my hatred to the righteous and they join my crusade."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

name: Loxodon Anchorite
text: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor: The loxodon ascribe religious superiority to those born albino, believing them to be spiritually pure.
Just one drop of the glistening oil can eventually stain even a soul as stalwart as a loxodon's beyond redemption.

name: Loxodon Gatekeeper
text: Artifacts, creatures, and lands your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: The gatekeepers are so fastidious that even the winds must wait to pass.

name: Loxodon Hierarch
text:
When Loxodon Hierarch enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
{G}{W}, Sacrifice Loxodon Hierarch: Regenerate each creature you control.

editions.flavor: "I have lived long, and I remember how this city once was. If my death serves to bring back the Ravnica in my memory, then so be it."

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
editions.flavor: "I have lived long, and I remember how this city once was. If my death serves to bring back the Ravnica in my memory, then so be it."

name: Loxodon Hierarch Avatar
text: Sacrifice a permanent: Regenerate target creature you control.

editions.flavor: RAV Participation Avatar

name: Loxodon Mender
text: {W}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact.

editions.flavor: The Auriok believe that in the hands of a loxodon, no weapon can be broken.

name: Loxodon Mystic
text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

editions.flavor: As the nim storm across the plains, a lone priest stands in their path. At his silent gesture, the battle line breaks, and the tide turns.
Elder mystics take their vow of silence so seriously that they impose it on any who enter their presence.

name: Loxodon Partisan
text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor: "This war is not about loxodon or leonin, Sylvok or Auriok. To defeat these rotters, we must do it together."

"On every plane I've encountered loxodons, I've found stalwart and loyal friends."
—Elspeth

name: Loxodon Peacekeeper
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, the player with the lowest life total gains control of Loxodon Peacekeeper. If two or more players are tied for lowest life total, you choose one of them, and that player gains control of Loxodon Peacekeeper.

name: Loxodon Punisher
text: Loxodon Punisher gets +2/+2 for each Equipment attached to it.

editions.flavor: The loxodons believe punishment comes in two steps: pain and atonement. They carry a weapon for each.

name: Loxodon Smiter
text:
Loxodon Smiter can't be countered.
If a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Loxodon Smiter, put it onto the battlefield instead of putting it into your graveyard.

name: Loxodon Stalwart
text:
Vigilance
{W}: Loxodon Stalwart gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Long ago, the Auriok attempted peace with the loxodons. The leonin attempted war. Neither succeeded.

name: Loxodon Warhammer
text:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and has trample and lifelink.
Equip {3}

editions.flavor:
"A crafter must imbue her weapon with part of her soul—something the Phyrexians are incapable of doing."
—Melira

"A crafter must imbue her weapon with part of her soul—something the Phyrexians are incapable of doing."
—Melira, sylvok outcast

"Tusks to splinter skulls. Steel to shatter scale."
—Warhammer inscription
"A crafter must imbue her weapon with part of her soul—something the Phyrexians are incapable of doing."—Melira
The Mirran elders vanished with Memnarch, leaving behind a generation of wayward orphans.

name: Loyal Cathar
text:
Vigilance
When Loyal Cathar dies, return it to the battlefield transformed under your control at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor:
"I trust myself to do my duty, even unto death. It's what comes after that I'm afraid of."
—Constable Visil, to Thalia

name: Loyal Gyrfalcon
text:
Defender, flying
Whenever you cast a white spell, Loyal Gyrfalcon loses defender until end of turn.

editions.flavor: It's tethered not to keep it from fleeing but to keep it from eating everything in sight.

name: Loyal Pegasus
text:
Flying
Loyal Pegasus can't attack or block alone.

editions.flavor:
"Even if I should die in the saddle, she will not let me fall to the ground."
—Hypatia of the Winged Horse

name: Loyal Retainers
text: Sacrifice Loyal Retainers: Return target legendary creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

name: Loyal Sentry
text: When Loyal Sentry blocks a creature, destroy that creature and Loyal Sentry.

editions.flavor: "My cause is simple: To stop you, at any cost, from ever seeing the inside of this keep."
"My cause is simple: To stop you, at any cost, from ever seeing the inside of this keep."

name: Lu Bu, Master-at-Arms
text: Haste; horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

editions.flavor: "Dong Zhuo's man, Lu Bu, warrior without peer,/ Far surpassed the champions of his sphere."
"Dong Zhuo's man, Lu Bu, warrior without peer, / Far surpassed the champions of his sphere."
"Dong Zhuo's man, Lu Bu, warrior without peer, / Far surpassed the champions of his sphere."
"Dong Zhuo's man, Lu Bu, warrior without peer, / Far surpassed the champions of his sphere."

name: Lucent Liminid
text: Flying

editions.flavor: It is a herald of the sun goddess, projected from the hallowed glass whenever her light passes through.

name: Ludevic, Necro-Alchemist
text:
At the beginning of each player's end step, that player may draw a card if a player other than you lost life this turn.
Partner (You can have two commanders if both have partner.)

editions.flavor: "How does one become a self-taught genius? Naturally, it requires brains."

name: Ludevic's Abomination
text: Trample

editions.flavor: After several frustrating experiments, the visionary Ludevic realized he needed to create a monster that fed on torch-wielding mobs.
After several frustrating experiments, the visionary Ludevic realized he needed to create a monster that fed on torch-wielding mobs.

name: Ludevic's Test Subject
text:
Defender
{1}{U}: Put a hatchling counter on Ludevic's Test Subject. Then if there are five or more hatchling counters on it, remove all of them and transform it.

name: Lull
text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

name: Lullmage Mentor
text:
Whenever a spell or ability you control counters a spell, you may create a 1/1 blue Merfolk creature token.
Tap seven untapped Merfolk you control: Counter target spell.

editions.flavor: "Many voices are needed to quiet this land."

name: Lumbering Falls
text:
Lumbering Falls enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.
{2}{G}{U}: Lumbering Falls becomes a 3/3 green and blue Elemental creature with hexproof until end of turn. It's still a land.

name: Lumbering Satyr
text: All creatures have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

editions.flavor:
The satyr carves the path that all of Rushwood follows.
—Cho-Arrim saying

name: Lumberknot
text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Whenever a creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Lumberknot.

editions.flavor: Animated by geists fused in its oak, it hungers for more life to add to its core.
Animated by geists fused in its oak, it hungers for more life to add to its core.
Animated by geists fused in its oak, it hungers for more life to add to its core.

name: Lumengrid Augur
text: {1}, {T}: Target player draws a card, then discards a card. If that player discards an artifact card this way, untap Lumengrid Augur.

editions.flavor: Information pumps like blood through vedalken society.

name: Lumengrid Drake
text:
Flying
Metalcraft — When Lumengrid Drake enters the battlefield, if you control three or more artifacts, return target creature to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Properly outfitted, drakes made perfect sentries for vedalken strongholds.

name: Lumengrid Gargoyle
text: Flying

editions.flavor:
"Anything that watches without sleep and fights without fear is a valuable ally against the Phyrexians."
—Kara Vrist, Neurok agent

name: Lumengrid Sentinel
text:
Flying
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may tap target permanent.

editions.flavor: The vedalken order their Neurok sentinels to watch over the shores of the Quicksilver Sea, as if they know of intruders yet to come.
His peers derive knowledge from ancient tomes locked within dark spires. He finds knowledge within the solitude of a lifetime spent watching the Quicksilver Sea.
The Neurok, like the vedalken, are on a constant quest for knowledge. It is their currency, their trade, their life.
The wardens keep watch over an endless sea of progress.

name: Lu Meng, Wu General
text: Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)

editions.flavor: As the Wu chief commander, Lu Meng conquered Shu-held Jingzhou in 219 by disguising soldiers as merchants on boats filled with hiding troops.
As the Wu chief commander, Lu Meng conquered Shu-held Jingzhou in 219 by disguising soldiers as merchants on boats filled with hiding troops.

name: Luminarch Ascension
text:
At the beginning of each opponent's end step, if you didn't lose life this turn, you may put a quest counter on Luminarch Ascension. (Damage causes loss of life.)
{1}{W}: Create a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying. Activate this ability only if Luminarch Ascension has four or more quest counters on it.

name: Luminate Primordial
text:
Vigilance
When Luminate Primordial enters the battlefield, for each opponent, exile up to one target creature that player controls and that player gains life equal to its power.

name: Luminesce
text: Prevent all damage that black sources and red sources would deal this turn.

editions.flavor:
"The White Shield is not the burnished metal you lash to your forearm but the conviction that burns in your chest."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter,
leader of the Order of the White Shield

"The White Shield is not the burnished metal you lash to your forearm but the conviction that burns in your chest."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter,
leader of the Order of the White Shield

name: Luminescent Rain
text: Choose a creature type. You gain 2 life for each permanent you control of that type.

editions.flavor: Storms in Lorwyn don't patter on village rooftops, but rather drench the clachan in rays of amber light.

name: Luminous Angel
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic
editions.flavor: "The spread of evil's destruction shall always be matched by the rise of the noble fallen."
"The spread of evil's destruction shall always be matched by the rise of the noble fallen."

name: Luminous Guardian
text:
{W}: Luminous Guardian gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{2}: Luminous Guardian can block an additional creature this turn.

editions.flavor: "There is no victory without virtue."

name: Luminous Wake
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, you gain 4 life.

editions.flavor:
"If destiny's champions have arisen to fight the Ancient Ones, then let me, too, do my part."
—Ravuel of Graypelt

name: Lumithread Field
text:
Creatures you control get +0/+1.
Morph {1}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor: Having conquered the Bastion of Suns, the Ota took its light for their own.

name: Lunar Avenger
text:
Sunburst (This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each color of mana spent to cast it.)
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Lunar Avenger: Lunar Avenger gains your choice of flying, first strike, or haste until end of turn.

name: Lunarch Inquisitors
text: When this creature transforms into Lunarch Inquisitors, you may exile another target creature until Lunarch Inquisitors leaves the battlefield.

editions.flavor: "We come bearing the tools of confession and absolution."

name: Lunarch Mantle
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has "{1}, Sacrifice a permanent: This creature gains flying until end of turn."

editions.flavor:
"A boon from the angels should never be cast aside."
—Manfried Ulmach, Chief Inquisitor

name: Lunar Force
text: When an opponent casts a spell, sacrifice Lunar Force and counter that spell.

editions.flavor: "Moonlight offers sublime warmth that brings me a comfort sunlight cannot provide."

name: Lunar Mystic
text: Whenever you cast an instant spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"I'm pleased this world has learned the moon affects more than the tides."
—Tamiyo, the Moon Sage

name: Lunge
text: Lunge deals 2 damage to target creature and 2 damage to target player.

editions.flavor: Cho-Arrim righteousness was no match for Benalish combat training.

name: Lunk Errant
text: Whenever Lunk Errant attacks alone, it gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"One's plenty," observed the merrow.
"Way too plenty," agreed the boggart.

name: Lupine Prototype
text: Lupine Prototype can't attack or block unless a player has no cards in hand.

editions.flavor:
"Ludevic saw it in a dream and set to work immediately, every detail already known. Can such genius be taught?"
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Lure
text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

editions.flavor: When setting a snare, success depends not on the quality of the trap, but the quality of the bait.
Jukai Forest was known for its secrets, which drew in many wayfarers and wizards. But it was those same secrets that kept most of those seekers from ever being heard from again.

"When setting a snare, success depends not on the quality of the trap, but the quality of the bait."
—Geyadrone Dihada

"When the forest wants something, no mortal mind can resist her."
—Maro
Deepwood's reach is not long, so it invites its enemies in.
It makes the insignificant conspicuous, the repulsive alluring, and the deadly irresistible.

"When the forest wants something, no mortal mind can resist her."
—Maro
Her true theft was to steal the soldiers away from their posts.

name: Lurebound Scarecrow
text:
As Lurebound Scarecrow enters the battlefield, choose a color.
When you control no permanents of the chosen color, sacrifice Lurebound Scarecrow.

editions.flavor: It's a fool's race to run if all is lost if it be won.

name: Lure of Prey
text:
Cast Lure of Prey only if an opponent cast a creature spell this turn.
You may put a green creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

name: Lurker
text: Lurker can't be the target of spells unless it attacked or blocked this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Each night we felt it watching us from the darkness beyond our fire. We only had one pack horse left."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

name: Lurking Arynx
text: Formidable — {2}{G}: Target creature blocks Lurking Arynx this turn if able. Activate this ability only if creatures you control have total power 8 or greater.

editions.flavor: Once it has your scent, it will hunt you from the Gurmag Swamp to Ayagor.

name: Lurking Automaton
text:
Reveal Lurking Automaton as you draft it and note how many cards you've drafted this draft round, including Lurking Automaton.
Lurking Automaton enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the highest number you noted for cards named Lurking Automaton.

name: Lurking Crocodile
text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

name: Lurking Evil
text: Pay half your life, rounded up: Lurking Evil becomes a 4/4 Horror creature with flying.

editions.flavor:
"Ash is our air, darkness our flesh."
—Phyrexian Scriptures

"Ash is our air, darkness our flesh."
—Phyrexian Scriptures

name: Lurking Informant
text:
({U/B} can be paid with either {U} or {B}.)
{2}, {T}: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card into that player's graveyard.

editions.flavor: In the undercity, forgetfulness is often encouraged at the point of a blade.

name: Lurking Jackals
text: When an opponent has 10 or less life, if Lurking Jackals is an enchantment, it becomes a 3/2 Hound creature.

editions.flavor: Often it's not the hunter or the hunted but the opportunist who thrives in Rath.

name: Lurking Nightstalker
text: Whenever Lurking Nightstalker attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The shadows know.

name: Lurking Predators
text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, you may put that card on the bottom of your library.

editions.flavor: All are prey to the eyes of the wild.
All are prey to the eyes of the wild.

name: Lurking Skirge
text: When a creature is put into an opponent's graveyard from the battlefield, if Lurking Skirge is an enchantment, Lurking Skirge becomes a 3/2 Imp creature with flying.

editions.flavor: They never miss a funeral.

name: Lush Growth
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a Mountain, Forest, and Plains.

editions.flavor: Naya's bounty spills over upon itself. Each leaf and flower struggles against the next with thrashing thorns, acidic pollen, and strangling roots.

name: Lust for War
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, Lust for War deals 3 damage to that creature's controller.
Enchanted creature attacks each turn if able.

name: Lu Su, Wu Advisor
text: {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

editions.flavor: Lu Su served as an intermediary between the Wu and Shu kingdoms until Zhou Yu's death in 210, when he became Wu's supreme commander.

name: Lux Cannon
text:
{T}: Put a charge counter on Lux Cannon.
{T}, Remove three charge counters from Lux Cannon: Destroy target permanent.

editions.flavor: There are few problems that can't be solved by putting a hole in the world.

name: Lu Xun, Scholar General
text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Whenever Lu Xun, Scholar General deals damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

name: Lyev Decree
text: Detain up to two target creatures your opponents control. (Until your next turn, those creatures can't attack or block and their activated abilities can't be activated.)

editions.flavor: The Azorius have so many codes and statutes that you're always in violation of one of them.

name: Lyev Skyknight
text:
Flying
When Lyev Skyknight enters the battlefield, detain target nonland permanent an opponent controls. (Until your next turn, that permanent can't attack or block and its activated abilities can't be activated.)

name: Lymph Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have absorb 1. (If a source would deal damage to a Sliver, prevent 1 of that damage.)

editions.flavor: Its skin remains in a flowing, liquid state that keeps its body coated with potent restorative lymph.

name: Lyna
text: Creatures you control have shadow. (They can block and be blocked only by creatures with shadow.)

editions.flavor: One of the few Soltari who can cross the shadow barrier, Lyna serves as an emissary to the outside world. A quick thinker and convincing speaker, she does whatever she can to lead her people out of the shadows and into substance.

name: Lynx
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

editions.flavor: Rarely seen, hardly heard, never caught.
Rarely seen, hardly heard, never caught.

name: Lys Alana Bowmaster
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever you cast an Elf spell, you may have Lys Alana Bowmaster deal 2 damage to target creature with flying.

name: Lys Alana Huntmaster
text: Whenever you cast an Elf spell, you may create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.

editions.flavor: From the highest tiers of Dawn's Light Palace to the deepest shade of Wren's Run, the silver notes of the horn shimmer through the air, and all who hear it feel its pull.

name: Lys Alana Scarblade
text: {T}, Discard an Elf card: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves you control.

editions.flavor: In beauty-obsessed Lys Alana, one cut of her blade means the difference between a high society feast and raking through the dungheap for scraps.
In beauty-obsessed Lys Alana, one cut of her blade means the difference between a high society feast and raking through the dungheap for scraps.

name: Lyzolda, the Blood Witch
text: {2}, Sacrifice a creature: Lyzolda, the Blood Witch deals 2 damage to target creature or player if the sacrificed creature was red. Draw a card if the sacrificed creature was black.

editions.flavor: Sacrificial rites take place before an audience of cheering cultists, each begging to be the next on stage.

name: Lyzolda, the Blood Witch Avatar
text:
Hellbent — As long as you have no cards in hand, if a source you control would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.
Hellbent — At the beginning of your end step, if you have no cards in hand, each of your opponents discards a card.

editions.flavor: DIS Prize Avatar

name: Maalfeld Twins
text: When Maalfeld Twins dies, create two 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens.

editions.flavor:
"Who am I to break up a family?"
—Gisa the Mad

name: Macabre Waltz
text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand, then discard a card.

editions.flavor:
"All dead move to the hollow rhythm of necromancy."
—Savra
Liliana is never one to follow someone else's lead.
"All dead move to the hollow rhythm of necromancy."—Savra

name: Macetail Hystrodon
text:
First strike, haste
Cycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

editions.flavor: The goblins tracked the hystrodon with much stealth and cunning. Then they were eaten with much pain and yelling.

name: Ma Chao, Western Warrior
text:
Horsemanship (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with horsemanship.)
Whenever Ma Chao, Western Warrior attacks alone, it can't be blocked this combat.

name: Machinate
text: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of artifacts you control. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

editions.flavor: As long as there are questions to be asked, the vedalken will ask them.

name: Mad Auntie
text:
Other Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Regenerate another target Goblin.

editions.flavor: One part cunning, one part wise, and many, many parts demented.
One part cunning, one part wise, and many, many parts demented.
One part cunning, one part wise, and many, many parts demented.

name: Madblind Mountain
text:
({T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.)
Madblind Mountain enters the battlefield tapped.
{R}, {T}: Shuffle your library. Activate this ability only if you control two or more red permanents.

name: Madcap Experiment
text: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal an artifact card. Put that card onto the battlefield and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. Madcap Experiment deals damage to you equal to the number of cards revealed this way.

name: Madcap Skills
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and has menace. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

editions.flavor: The larger the crowd, the harder it is for them to run away.

name: Maddening Imp
text:
Flying
{T}: Non-Wall creatures the active player controls attack this turn if able. At the beginning of the next end step, destroy each of those creatures that didn't attack this turn. Activate this ability only during an opponent's turn and only before combat.

name: Maddening Wind
text:
Enchant creature
Cumulative upkeep {G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Maddening Wind deals 2 damage to that player.

editions.flavor:
"It is Freyalise, walking on the world."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

name: Mad Dog
text: At the beginning of your end step, if Mad Dog didn't attack or come under your control this turn, sacrifice it.

editions.flavor: The bones it buries may be yours.

name: Mad Prophet
text:
Haste
{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: "There's no heron in the moon! It's a shrew, a five-legged shrew, with a voice like whispering thunder!"
"There's no heron in the moon! It's a shrew, a five-legged shrew, with a voice like whispering thunder!"
"I have seen it. Seen the end, seen the beginning, the beginning of the end. Not death, no, no. Transcendence!"

name: Madrush Cyclops
text: Creatures you control have haste.

editions.flavor: Death comes in the blink of an eye.

name: Maelstrom Archangel
text:
Flying
Whenever Maelstrom Archangel deals combat damage to a player, you may cast a nonland card from your hand without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor: There is no world where angels fear to tread.

name: Maelstrom Archangel Avatar
text: At end of combat, for each creature you controlled at the time it dealt combat damage to a player this turn, copy a random card with the same mana cost as that creature. You may pay {3}. If you do, choose one of those copies. If a copy of a permanent card is chosen, you may put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of that card. If a copy of an instant or sorcery card is chosen, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

editions.flavor: CON Prize Avatar

name: Maelstrom Djinn
text:
Flying
Morph {2}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Maelstrom Djinn is turned face up, put two time counters on it and it gains vanishing. (At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)

name: Maelstrom Nexus
text: The first spell you cast each turn has cascade. (When you cast your first spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom of your library in a random order.)

name: Maelstrom Pulse
text: Destroy target nonland permanent and all other permanents with the same name as that permanent.
